name: HMAD
description: Hidden Markov Anomaly Detection (HMAD) is an extension of the one-class SVM for data featuring underlying dependency structures. By embedding data and its latent state sequence into a structured joint feature space, HMAD can learn anomaly boundaries while controlling outlier rates.
bibtex: @InProceedings{pmlr-v37-goernitz15,title = {Hidden Markov Anomaly Detection},author ={Goernitz, Nico and Braun, Mikio and Kloft, Marius},booktitle = {Proceedings of the 32nd International Conference on Machine Learning},pages =    {1833--1842},year =   {2015},volume =   {37},series =   {Proceedings of Machine Learning Research},month = {07--09 Jul},publisher = {PMLR}}
